Labels for pivot_format

pivot_labels.Rd

Labels for pivot_format

pivot_labels(
  stats = "Statistic",
  n = "N",
  p = "%",
  p_col = "Col %",
  p_row = "Row %",
  rows = NULL,
  cols = NULL
)

Arguments

stats

Name of statistics column.
n

Count.
p

Percentage.
p_col

Column perc.
p_row

Row perc.
rows, cols

Labels for variables use as rows/cols.

Value

a list that can be use in pivot_format.

Examples

library(flexpivot)
library(magrittr)
data("nobel_laureates")

# Change labels displayed in table
nobel_laureates %>%
  pivot_table("category", "gender", na_label = "Manquant") %>%
  pivot_format(
    labels = pivot_labels(
      stats = "Statistique",
      n = "Effectif",
      p = "Pourcentage",
      p_col = "% colonne",
      p_row = "% ligne",
      rows = c("Categorie"),
      cols = "Genre"
    )
  )

#> a flextable object.
#> col_keys: `Categorie`, `Statistique`, `male`, `female`, `Manquant`, `Total` 
#> header has 2 row(s) 
#> body has 28 row(s) 
#> original dataset sample: 
#>           Categorie Statistique  male female Manquant Total
#> 1         Chemistry    Effectif   179      5        0   184
#> 2         Chemistry Pourcentage 18.8%   0.5%       0% 19.4%
#> 3         Chemistry   % colonne 20.6%   9.3%       0% 19.4%
#> 4         Chemistry     % ligne 97.3%   2.7%       0%  100%
#> 5 Economic Sciences    Effectif    82      2        0    84
